alert.note: Alert for Floyd (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 8:19AM EDT until July 31 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Levisa Fork at Prestonsburg affecting Floyd County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Levisa Fork at Prestonsburg. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Flood gate is closed to the storm drain system in Prestonsburg. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 26.3 feet. - The river crested at 32.1 feet around noon Friday. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 10.8 feet early Thursday morning. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. The next statement will be issued by 12 PM EDT.
